data.text: @DrEricDing Would the vaccines still work?  Do we eventually need a fourth vaccine?

@craigaroo @RevDrBarber @DrEricDing @DrWilliamKu It dominates because of speed and ease of transmission. Then speed of viral replication once infected. After that the host immunity and the strain pathogenicity determine the case by case outcome. These data are scary.
@asmallerflame @Craigdavidfc @DrEricDing Yup we won’t, so as I said , policy should reflect the wold we have , not the world we wish we have

@asmallerflame @ManfredeKaren @Craigdavidfc @DrEricDing So, I’m selfish for not thinking about you, but, you’re NOT selfish not thinking about everyone else in the world? Sorry, I do have empathy for you, I just believe it’s time for society to return to normality.

@NCancellable @ManfredeKaren @Craigdavidfc @DrEricDing No, but it would make society safer for me, a person with COPD.

You just don't want to have to think about people like me anymore.

@proverbialcat @jsmyee @exasperated123 @Sky_Lee_1 @DrEricDing @DrWilliamKu Covid isn’t going away. It’s going to mutate forever regardless of what we do. 

Get vaxxed and get on with life. No sense in worrying about something you have no control over

@jsmyee @degs99 @exasperated123 @Sky_Lee_1 @DrEricDing @DrWilliamKu People may feel like they're done with Covid-19, but it ain't done with us. That's the problem with not having enough of the WORLD population fully vaccinated. It allows too many vectors for mutations, each one having the possibility of escaping existing immunity.
@DrEricDing We need all of these measures, vaccines alone won't do it. https://t.co/Qj00vRKBd6
@DrEricDing @birdie111222 My wife in the Philippines told me about this so very sad
